comments:
Version: 3.1.0
Build id: I20050627-1435

Myself and two others have been facing the problem . 
Here is the description of what I have been facing : 
I have a plug-in called cwmbuilder and that plug-in uses SiteRulParser of 
CWMClassesNew.jar which is there at the root of the plug-in . When launching 
the plug-in thru Run or Debug , its working perfect . When trying to export the 
plug-in as a jar file and placing that jar under the plugins sub dir of 
installed eclipse dir , I am getting NoClassdefFoundException as shown . 
The log : 
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: 
com/singingfish/annotation/languages/cwm/SiteRuleParser
	at 
com.singingfish.annotationtool.builder.Builder$CWMResourceDeltaVisitor.visit
(Builder.java:103)

(ResourceDelta.java:68)

=================================================================
I could see similar bugs and I see that they are fixed . But it is not working.

This is blocking my project . Please do resolve this fast . 
Thanks,
-Ranga

Somebody please change this to P1 . Our project deadline is tomorrow and this 
bug is yet to be solved .
What does the build.properties file look like for your plug-in?

(In reply to comment #2)
> What does the build.properties file look like for your plug-in?

===============================
my build.properties
------------------
source.. = src/
output.. = bin/
bin.includes = plugin.xml,\
               META-INF/,\
               .,\
               CWMClassesNew.jar
			   
jars.extra.classpath = CWMClassesNew.jar

Please suggest something soon .

My MANIFEST.MF goes this way.

Manifest-Version: 1.0
Bundle-ManifestVersion: 2
Bundle-Name: Builder Plug-in
Bundle-SymbolicName: cwmbuilder; singleton:=true
Bundle-Version: 1.0.0
Bundle-Activator: com.singingfish.annotationtool.builder.BuilderPlugin
Bundle-Localization: plugin
Require-Bundle: org.eclipse.ui,
 org.eclipse.core.runtime,
 org.eclipse.core.resources
Eclipse-AutoStart: true


----------------------------------
And I have my external jar file(CWMnewClassesNew.jar) under the plug-in root 
directory . I even tried adding this jar into a lib folder and refer the same 
in MANIFEST.MF thru "Bundle-ClassPath: lib/CWMClassesNew.jar" enrty.
Please do suggest something fast . 

-Ranga

If you are trying to ship your plug-in as a folder, then your manifest.mf is
missing the Bundle-Classpath entry. 
Try to create a new plug-in and compare the structure created and what you have.
*** Bug 110410 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

This type of error would not happen if PDE UI was providing more assistance.
Please cc yourself to bug #34165.
